document.heading: Judith E. Heumann Memorial Bridge Designation Act of 2025
To officially designate the bridge on Connecticut Avenue, NW, located between Devonshire Place, NW and Macomb Street, NW, as the Judith E. Heumann Memorial Bridge.

history.summary: BILL SUMMARY - As introduced, Bill 26-165 would designate the bridge on Connecticut Avenue NW, located between Devonshire Place NW and Macomb Street NW as the Judith E. Heumann Memorial Bridge.

document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Judith E. Heumann Memorial Bridge Designation Act of 2025".

section.text: Pursuant to sections 401 and 422 of the Street and Alley Closing and Acquisition Procedures Act of 1982, effective March 10, 1983 (D.C. Law 4-201; D.C. Official Code §§ 9-204.01, and 9-204.22), the Council officially designates the bridge on Connecticut Avenue, NW, located between Devonshire Place, NW and Macomb Street, NW, as depicted on the plat in the committee report, as "Judith E. Heumann Memorial Bridge".

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement in the committee report as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

section.heading: Effective date.
section.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto) and a 30-day period of congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Official Code § 1-206.02(c)(1)).
